title: Check for a Balanced Equation
text: Check if the equation is balanced or not. If not, balance the equation.

title: Identify the Stoichiometric Factor
text: The stoichiometric factor relating the two substances of interest is $$2$$ mol 2\text{H}_3\text{PO}_4 / $$3$$ mol \text{Ca(OH)}_2.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of Ca(OH)2
text: The molar amount of Ca(OH)2 is derived by multiplying the provided molar amount of H3PO4 by multiplying the stoichiometric factor.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of Ca(OH)2
text: What is $$(1.36$$ mol \text{H}_3\text{PO}_4)*(2 mol 2\text{H}_3\text{PO}_4 / $$3$$ mol \text{Ca(OH)}_2)? Keep two decimal places.
